course_name: Participatory Research, Development and Extension Practice
description: Practice issues in conducting participatory research, development and extension in agriculture, resource management, environmental management and community development. Includes practical methods for professionals working with diverse communities and multi-stakeholder groups. Includes qualitative research, participatory and gender analysis methods, and tools for systems thinking, incorporating cultural differences and facilitating participatory learning. (Minimum enrolment required for internal offering - 8)
incompatible: CERD1002 or 2001 or 2005 or MGTS2960 or ENVM2521
